column7: description
column389: wineStyles/Californian Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon Red
column392: wineStyles/Californian Knights Valley Cabernet Sauvignon Red
column394: wineStyles/Californian Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon Red
column398: wineStyles/Californian Russian River Valley Pinot Noir Red
column399: wineStyles/Californian Santa Lucia Highlands Pinot Noir Red
column400: wineStyles/Californian Santa Maria Valley Pinot Noir Red
column401: wineStyles/Californian Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir Red
column402: wineStyles/Californian Sonoma County Cabernet Sauvignon Red
column403: wineStyles/Californian Sta. Rita Hills Pinot Noir Red

column369: Paul Hobbs Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015

column7: This wine displays a magnificent, compelling and inviting nose that is quintessential of Cabernet Sauvignon. Unrestrained wild cherry, currant and mulberry fragrances arise with pronounced notes of cocoa, coriander, and wintergreen. Sublayers of dried herbs, cedar, tobacco leaf and slate provide substantive foundation to the aromatic profile. On the palate a veritable explosion of fresh, ripe, dark berry fruits. Tangy blackberry, juicy black cherry, pomegranate and cranberry are mingled with lovely blueberry and raspberry accents, underscored with kirsch and rhubarb. Integrated nicely with toasty oak, graphite and forest floor. Full bodied and a very silky texture, this wine glides into a long, generous finish resonating with ripe fruit and exotic spice allowing an amazing aging capabilities.

column369: Paul Hobbs Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015
Ketcham Estate Five Clone Pinot Noir 2018

column7:
Bold, dry and full-bodied, this great value for money Bonanza Cabernet Sauvignon is an all-time favourite within the Vivino community. Crafted by Chuck Wagner at Caymus Vineyards, this wine is a delightful and highly accessible choice to complement a meal, making it perfect for dinner parties. Pairs exquisitely with beef, lamb, game and poultry, with velvety tannins cutting through meat with ease. One Vivino user also mentioned in their Bonanza Cabernet Sauvignon review that this wine pairs exceptionally well with a fillet steak. The bold flavor profile boasts notes of oak, vanilla and chocolate, as well as black and red fruits, adding to its unique balance of smoothness and dryness.

Boasting a highly regarded position in the top 5% of wines from California, Bonanza Cabernet Sauvignon Lot N.V. has a huge reputation preceding it. Coming exceptionally highly-acclaimed, the Vivino community Bonanza Cabernet Sauvignon reviews speak for themselves. ‘Outstanding wine!’, ‘excellent California cab with all the vanilla leather dark fruit you look for’ and ‘an affordable yet excellent non vintage California cab’ are among just some of the glowing Bonanza Cabernet Sauvignon reviews.

This beautiful wine opens with aromas of blackberry, violets and chocolate covered cherries. On the palate, it displays flavours of dark berries, mocha and cherries.  With elegant, velvety tannins that enhance the mouthfeel, it has a long fruit driven finish.

Hints of mint, eucalyptus, and cedar are present in the nose while moderate tannins balance layers of dark berries and black cherries on the palate. This is a fruit driven Cabernet Sauvignon that has the tannin structure to last many years, but drinks well now.

Aromas of black cherry, plum and violets, followed by subtle flavors of strawberry and allspice. Firm yet supple tannins finish off this approachable fruit-driven Cabernet Sauvignon, making it ideal for a variety of food pairings.

column369: Armida Tina's Block Maple Vineyards Zinfandel 2021

column7:
One of the most popular wines among the Vivino community, the bold and earthy Beau Vigne Cult Cabernet Sauvignon boasts a unique complexity with each glass. With origins in Beau Vigne winery, Cult Cabernet Sauvignon has all the trademarks of a prodigious Napa Valley wine. Our Vivino community lovingly describe the Beau Vigne Cult Cabernet Sauvignon as starting out tannic and finishing to chocolate, with black fruit, leather and tobacco notes, as well as a whisper of anise and mushroom inbetween.

Coined in the 1900s, the term “cult wine” was used to describe Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon wines that sold for large sums of money. Growing in popularity over the twentieth and twenty-first centuries, cult wines present a benchmark to a region’s potential quality, which you can taste from the first sip of Cult Cabernet Sauvignon.

Boasting a charming, deep ruby colour, Beau Vigne Cult Cabernet Sauvignon is a much-loved wine, predominantly down to its careful ageing process, complex mouthfeel and versatility when it comes to food pairings. Perfectly complementing hearty meat dishes such as beef, lamb, game and poultry, as well as mature and hard cheese, the Beau Vigne Cult Cabernet Sauvignon (in particular Cult Cabernet Sauvignon 2019, 2017 and 2014) is a wonderful red wine for hosting.

column369: Verdon Estate Reserve No.3 Cabernet Sauvignon 2020

column7:
Proving you don’t hold the name ‘hero’ for nothing, Beau Vigne Hero Proprietary Red is something a little special within the Vivino community and beyond. Produced in Beau Vigne winery, Hero Proprietary Red has all the trademarks of a prodigious Napa Valley wine we’ve come to know and love. 

Due to favorable growing conditions for a wide range of grapes, from warm-weather varieties like Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, and Sauvignon Blanc, to cool-weather varieties like Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, the Napa Valley lends itself to producing premium quality wines – which is why it’s no surprise this bold, Californian red is strikingly popular.

Boasting a rich, dark tone, and giving a silky, soft, round entrance on the palate, Beau Vigne Reserve Proprietary Red is an extremely favourable wine for dinner parties up and down the U.S. It’s also the perfect red to accompany a hearty meat dish, such as veal, lamb, poultry and beef, propelling its favor in the hosting world.

Coming with an unrivalled accolade, Beau Vigne Hero Proprietary Red 2018 is rated better than any other year for this wine, and Beau Vigne Hero Proprietary Red Napa Valley 2019 is rated among the top 3% of all wines in the world. With notes of black fruit, plum jam, cassis, coffee grinds, dark chocolate, charred wood, toasted cedar and licorice, our users have described it as ‘full bodied with a medium plus finish’ and ‘great tasting with a bite’.

column369: Thurlow Cellars Pit Viper Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Verdon Estate Reserve No.5 Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7:
Hailed by the Vivino community as ‘bottled alchemy’, the sophisticated and full bodied Widow's Peak Pinot Noir is silky smooth and easy to drink, making it the perfect evening meal pairing.

Leaning towards a fruitier, New World style, this wine boasts an intensely fragrant aroma characterized by red and purple fruit notes, plum preserves, subtle hints of luscious cocoa powder and sweet herbal nuances, as well as an abundance of vivid, concentrated flavors. Close your eyes and let Widow's Peak Pinot Noir engage every sense.

Perfectly pairing with beef, veal, poultry and game, Widow's Peak Pinot Noir is an essential red to have waiting in the wings for any dinner party. If you’re looking for a specific vintage to try first, Widow's Peak Pinot Noir Sonoma County 2020 vintage rates better than any other year for this wine, so it's a great starting point to sample this variety. Additionally, coming with huge accolades, Widow's Peak Pinot Noir 2021 vintage is the most popular and highly rated among the Vivino community.

column369: Erikson & Caradin Lotus & Quill Pinot Noir 2020
Belharra Alder Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir 2019

column7: Bright crimson red in color. Aromas of black cherry and ripe plums combine with subtle notes of dried herbs and smoke. The palate entry shows flavors of cranberry, fresh raspberry, and ripe cherry, complemented by hints of vanilla and baking spice. A balance of savory, cedar and cocoa powder, and sweet, fig jam and ripe blackberry, round out the mouth-feel.
column369: Belle Glos Dairyman Vineyard Pinot Noir 2021

column7: Deeply and intensely colored, this is a massive wine with a complex, sophisticated nose, offering black currant, cassis, sweet cherry and blackberry, with underlying layers of graphite, tobacco leaf, leather and wet gravel. Soft notes of menthol and desert sage weave together and integrate the aromas of fruit and earth. Breathtakingly bright fruit immediately greets the palate, juicy boysenberry, crushed cherries and fresh blueberries, with cranberry and raspberry accented by cedar, black plum and dried herbs. Powerful and rich, polished in style and structure, the opulent fruit core transitions seamlessly and exquisitely to a robust mid- palate showing black olive, licorice and eastern spices, finishing long and elegantly with black cherry, cocoa and plum. An outstanding vintage.
column369: DAOU Reserve Eye of the Falcon 2020

column7: Luxurious dark cherry, boysenberry, blackcurrant and black fig aromas, with scents of oak toast and dark chocolate. The wine’s vibrant acidity, supple, seamlessly integrated tannins and impeccable balance contribute to a round, plush mouthfeel, leading to a long, savoury finish marrying rich boysenberry fruit. French oak spice and a hint of dark chocolate.
Medium body with silky mouth feel. The palate at first delivers a burst of ripe red fruits, heavy cream and loads of cascading exotic spices finishing with subtle crushed black pepper.

Aromas and flavors. Juicy berry fruits, chocolate, vanilla, dried herb and char blend together in harmony on a soft, velvety texture. The tannins are incredibly supple and long, adding to the warmth and elegance of the wine.
column369: Nickel & Nickel State Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7: The Beringer winemaking team has worked the Knights Valley vineyards for two decades, watching the vineyards evolve and noting which blocks and rows are particularly unique. Using fruit from those prized blocks, Mark Beringer has crafted the Knights Valley Reserve Cabernet, which provides the purest and most layered expression of the unique terroir found in Knights Valley.
column369: Beringer Knights Valley Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
Arling Blaze Hope Dies Last Proprietary Red 2022

column7: This full-bodied wine opens with aromas of violets, lavender, fresh rosemary, and espresso. On the palate we find flavors of black cherries, red plums, mountain blueberries, mission figs, and chocolate covered orange peel with sweet clay, freshly turned earth, and pencil shavings giving way to ripe, mouth-coating tannins on the long and powerful finish.

column369: Ashby Park Estates Cabernet Sauvignon Reserve 2022
Erikson & Caradin Craftsmen & Wolves Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7: Unbridled, youthful quality of plum, black cherry and illiberality fruit that is balanced by an elegant layer of cedar, tobacco leaf and Thai basil in both the nose and on the palate.  A bit headstrong, and beautifully balanced, this velvety, unctuous Cabernet embodies the best of the vineyard.  With its perfectly ripe fruit, just the right amount of oak and rich tannin's.

column369: Beau Vigne Napa Valley Cabby Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7: Its intense billowing fragrance begins with blue fruits then shifts markedly to red fruit and flowers – blueberry, mulberry, blackberry, then bing cherry, violet, and rose. Ripe fruit commingles with tart pomegranate and winter spice, further revealing sassafras root, subtle spearmint, and cherry cola with gravel, loam, and hint of minerality. Mouthfeel is dense, rich, and decadent with loads of luscious fruit, vanillin, and cascading spice.

The 2022 DAOU Cabernet Sauvignon exemplifies Paso Robles. The nose is highly perfumed, showing aromas of black cherry, cassis, plum, desert sage, sandalwood, and dusty minerality. Secondary aromas reveal notes of cigar box, leather, bay leaf, and black olive. The palate is rich and weighty, offering generous flavors of black raspberry, spicy currant, and blueberry compote with impressions of Bing cherry, Boysenberry, fig, and baking spices. Ripe, fine-grained tannins carry into a structured finish with lingering accents of cherry, espresso, and vanilla.

Barrel Aging: 
8 months in 50% new French oak

Full-bodied and rich, balanced by a touch of acidity and firm, polished tannins, Austin Hope’s
Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon is as popular for dinner gatherings as it is a go-to for hearty lunches at home. Boasting a deep, ruby red colour, this aesthetically pleasing red’s nose is complex with aromas of blackberry, black cherry and cassis, followed by earthy notes of vanilla, leather, oak and spice. 

Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon pairs delightfully with beef, lamb, game and poultry, due to its tannins, which help cut through the richness and fattiness of these meats, enhancing their flavors and providing a pleasing balance. Beyond its taste, Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon's iconic bottle and label makes it an excellent choice for gifting, guaranteed to delight recipients on any celebratory occasion.

This exquisite cabernet sauvignon is celebrated as having ‘a riot of mixed ripe black fruit in the mouth’, with one member of the Vivino community admitting that it is ‘one of the best wines I’ve had at this price point! Lots of fruit but very smooth and balanced. Mid-body cab, but drinks bigger.’ You can read hundreds of Vivino users’ honest reviews and see for yourself before trying. As for which vintage to opt for, all possess their own charm, but Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 ranks number one in the top 25 Californian Cabernet Sauvignon wines in the United States right now.

column369: Ty Caton Vineyards Caton Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2019

column7: Rich and full-bodied, with a dense purple color, beautiful inky fruit, and touches of graphit and earth. There's lots of blackberry as well in this full-bodied wine.

It has fruit flavors, vibrant acidity and mature, muscular tannins allowed us to complement the wine with bolder amounts of vanilla-oak and mocha nuances this year—both from new barrels and long oak aging.
column369: Beaulieu Vineyard (BV) Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon 2020

column7: This wine exhibits dark concentrated fruit flavors of mountain blueberry and black raspberry and well-integrated fine-grained tannins with excellent mountain acidity. Big, bold, and ultra-ripe on the attack, packed with small black-fruit preserves and blueberry, doused with crème de wine.

Aromas of bright wild strawberries are mixed with brown spice and darjeeling on the nose. The palate is textured almost like a black tea with flavors of shoyu and wild strawberries. Shows great today but this wine will shed its layers in the cellar as well.

This is a full-bodied wine that exhibits high-class aromas of black currants, coffee bean, crushed flowers, and hints of dark chocolate. Seamless on the palate, it starts with black fruit flavors, builds on silky tannins, and finishes with notes of vanilla, olives, and licorice. Throughout, it is fresh, elegant and shows bright fruit accompanied with great acidity.

A dark plum color, this wine opens with the scents of baking chocolate and fig, enhanced by notes of dried stone fruit, Christmas spice and wisps of Mesquite smoke. The palate is rich and supple, driven by dark berry flavors. Fresh earthiness and smoky notes rounded out with tannins that are leathery and smooth.

column369: The Hess Collection Lion Tamer Cabernet Sauvignon 2019

column7: Deep red in color, this wine has intense aromas of nougat, brown spice, bright cherry, and wet stone. The palate is full and layered with flavors of red berry fruit coulis and bright acidity. Very long and rich it is a true representation of the Sta. Rita Hills.

Dark red/black in color, the nose gives an immediate aroma of raspberries and warm baking spices, leading into cassis and clove. The palate has elements of pie crust, with smooth, silky tannins and well balanced acidity.

Unbridled, youthful quality of plum, black cherry and illiberality fruit that is balanced by an elegant layer of cedar, tobacco leaf and Thai basil in both the nose and on the palate.  A bit headstrong, and beautifully balanced, this velvety, unctuous Cabernet embodies the best of the vineyard.  With its perfectly ripe fruit, just the right amount of oak and rich tannin's.

Hailing from one of the most luxurious wine regions in the world, Napa Valley, Beringer Distinction Series Cabernet Sauvignon is a full bodied red wine that’s perfect for both special occasions and sophisticated dinner parties. Bold in flavor with silky tannins and oak characteristics, you can expect notes of black fruit, leather and smoke for a balanced complexity. 

Wildly loved by the Vivino community, it is recommended you pair this wine with hearty meat dishes such as beef, lamb, game and chicken, alongside mature, hard cheeses. Why not try serving it up at your next charcuterie evening? If our wine community is anything to go by, we’re sure it will go down a hit. 

Beringer is one of Napa’s most iconic wineries, dating back 145 years and is renowned for being innovators within the wine industry. Not only this, but they are the only winery to have both a red and white wine named #1 wine in the world by Wine Spectator. 

If you want to learn more about this wine’s vintages, read reviews, or learn prices, you’ve come to the right place.
column369: Beringer Napa Valley Distinction Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Black Label) 2019
Paul Hobbs Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2015

column7: It is bright scarlet in color and possesses aromas of rhubarb, licorice, graphite, and white pepper. On the palate, flavors of sweet plumb, cherries and vanilla meld with hints of tarragon. The wine is balanced with silky tannins, earthiness and a kick of spice.

column369: Armida Il Campo Estate Field Blend 2021

column7:
It has lovely aromas of summer berries with hints of anise, cocoa powder and caramel on the
nose. Concentrated flavors of mocha, cherry, ripe raspberry and nutmeg lead to a rounded finish with restrained, yet velvety tannins.

This is a rich, layered and mouth-filling wine with ripe, integrated tannins and a seductive fine-grained finish. Dark aromas of toffee, hickory, bacon, cedar and smoke are contrasted by more vibrant elements of red currant and spearmint. On the palate, rich black currant and blueberry flavors dominate, underscored by subtler notes of earth and oak.

The 2022 vintage delivers yet another bewitching blend with trademark Pessimist flair. An intensely aromatic nose begins with fragrances of blueberry, boysenberry and black plum. Deeper layers reveal lavender, truffle, cocoa and tamarind spice with hints of cherry pipe tobacco, leather, mint and smoked meats. A bright, vibrant palate offers generous flavors of black cherry, cranberry, crème de cassis and pomegranate. Notes of lilac, anise and black olive complement the rich fruit while the mouth is flooded with lush, silky textures. Lingering accents of blueberry and raspberry round out this elegantly balanced wine.

column369: Michael David Winery Earthquake Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Landy Family Vineyards Gravel Series Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
Rockslide Vineyards Sawtooth Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Quilt The Woven Cellar Aged Release 2016

column7:
This rich and intense red from Sling and Spear winery is constantly growing in popularity with the Vivino community. With origins in the Dry Creek Valley wine region, located northwest of Healdsburg town and south of Lake Sonoma, this Californian Zinfandel is fresh, pure and silky smooth. In fact, this bold, fruity red comes out in the top 12% of all wines from Dry Creek Valley.

The bold flavor profile boasts notes of black fruit, with oaky and earthy undertones. Pairing perfectly with beef, lamb and poultry, this makes an excellent dinner wine. One member of the Vivino community even suggested that the Sling & Spear Zinfandel is ‘big enough to stand up to spicy Asian food yet subtle enough to pair with a steak.’

The Sling & Spear Zinfandel 2017 vintage is well worth a try, given that it’s secured its place as Vivino users’ favorite, boasting more than 200 glowing ratings. Having said this, Sling & Spear Zinfandel 2016 vintage rates better than any other year for this wine.

column369: Rockslide Vineyards Sawtooth Ridge Cabernet Sauvignon 2022

column7:
Grown where microclimates are plentiful, and sunshine is guaranteed, California is a haven for grape growers – you’ll find each wine variety originating here as unique and delightful as the next.

With its widely recognisable bottle and label, Conundrum Red Blend is both the perfect hosting and gifting wine. Bold and slightly acidic, Conundrum Red Blend is derived from renowned wine-producing areas in California, comprising deep-red grape varieties like Zinfandel, giving it its inky colour and consistency.

Maintaining its popularity with the Vivino community year after year, the Conundrum Red Blend boasts notes of oak, vanilla and chocolate, as well as black and red fruits. Celebrated by Vivino users as ‘a very nice wine for price’ with a ‘silky texture, nice tannin profile, pleasant berry taste with a very smooth finish’, it’s a perfect choice for those seeking exceptional quality without breaking the bank. 

Although the Vivino community suggests it’s ‘extremely easy to drink on its own’, pairing with beef, lamb, veal and poultry is a match made in heaven. The winemakers themselves suggest being daring and drinking slightly chilled to enhance the fruit profile and enjoy any time of year.

column369: Beau Vigne Old Rutherford Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7: Lovely complexity defines the aromas of this Bordeaux‐style blend. Ripe blueberry, dark anise and woodsy notes, a hint of bright raspberry and a touch of sweet herbals show both in the aromas as well as the flavors of this lively blend. Somewhat lighter than the Cabernet in structure, the wine shows its composition with hints of sweet bay leaf and dried cherry on the finish.

Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon is a highly regarded wine originating from California's Paso Robles region. Crafted by Austin Hope, a prominent winemaker and owner of Hope Family Wines, this Cabernet Sauvignon has earned a stellar reputation within the world of wine.

Paso Robles, known for its diverse terroir and microclimates, provides an ideal setting for producing exceptional Cabernet Sauvignon. This wine primarily consists of Cabernet Sauvignon grapes, renowned for their deep color, robust flavors, and potential for aging.

The winemaking process is characterized by meticulous attention to detail. Grapes are hand-harvested and carefully sorted before undergoing fermentation in stainless steel tanks. The wine then ages in a combination of new and used French oak barrels, imparting complexity and structure.

Austin Hope's Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon boasts a deep, inky hue and a rich aromatic profile. It is characterized by ripe dark fruit notes, including blackberry and plum, complemented by cassis, mocha, and subtle spice. On the palate, it offers a full-bodied experience with velvety tannins and a satisfying, enduring finish.

Notably, this wine is appreciated for its aging potential. While it is enjoyable when young, it has the capacity to evolve and gain greater complexity and depth with several years of bottle aging, making it a prized choice among wine collectors.

Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon has garnered numerous accolades and high ratings from wine critics, firmly establishing its status as a premier wine. Additionally, Hope Family Wines, including Austin Hope, is dedicated to sustainable and environmentally responsible winemaking practices, underscoring their commitment to preserving the land for future generations.
column369: Austin Hope Paso Robles Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Cobb Coastlands Vineyard Diane Cobb Pinot Noir 2017

column7: Andrus is smooth and elegant, with firm tannins balancing the rich cherry and berry fruit and the creamy butterscotch notes contributed by toasted French oak barrels. The finish is long and graceful, with lingering flavors of dark berries, vanilla and semi-sweet chocolate.
column369: Pine Ridge Andrus Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7: Aromas of crushed red and black summer berries, rose petal and herbs. In the mouth the generous, lush black and red fruits integrate enticingly with sage, tobacco leaf, smoke and black spice all wrapped within a structure of ripe Stags Leap District tannins.
column369: Shafer One Point Five Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Boars’ View The Coast Pinot Noir 2018
Meyer Family Cellars Le Bon Bon 2017

column7:
Celebrated by the Vivino community as ‘bold yet smooth; rich and complex’, ‘very well balanced’ and ‘wonderful on the first sip’, this Caymus Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon demands attention.

The vibrant, oaky and earthy Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon, with subtle black fruit undertones, is reassuringly bold and velvety, and for this reason, has earned its place as one of the Vivino community’s favourite Cabernet Sauvignons. One Vivino member even commented, ‘Just wow! An explosion of different flavors’, and another admitted that they were ‘not sure how much better you can get for any price’.

With origins in the renowned Caymus Vineyards, the famous winemaking region’s unique heritage can be tasted with each drop. In 1972, Chuck Wagner and his late parents, Lorna and Charlie Sr., opened Caymus Vineyards, starting off with 240 cases of Cabernet Sauvignon. Over half a century later, Caymus Vineyards in Napa Valley remains 100% family-owned and run, and uses many of the same winemaking techniques of generations before.

If you’re looking for a specific year to try first, Caymus Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 vintage is ranked 93 by wine professional, Wilfred Wong. However, Caymus Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2020 and 2018 vintages are both in high demand across the U.S. and beyond. Pair any of these vintages with beef, lamb, game, poultry or a cheese board for a dinner party match made in heaven. Bon appétit!

Aromas of this rich, fully ripe Bordeaux-blend style wine are as complex as they are intense. On the palate, the entry is driven by flavors of boysenberry, blueberry, and fresh raspberries, with the darker notes of mocha, vanilla and cedar a dding weight to the mid-palate. Bright and soft at the finish.

It has deep, dark, opaque purple colour; Scrumptious aromas of crushed black fruits, chocolate covered raspberries, espresso and violets. The mouth feel is rich and concentrated, with smooth, silky tannins. Flavours of plum, blackberries, freshly cut blueberries and coffee lead to a long, luxurious finish.

Aromatics like boysenberry jam and black plum lead to candied raspberries and nutmeg. The palate is ripe with dark stone fruits, blueberries, a hint of meatiness and confectionary orange, akin to mandarin encased foie gras.
Aromas and flavours of dark cherry, black coffee, sweet vanilla and wet forest floor with rose petal, cranberry, blueberry, oregano, and sage.

column369: Tom Eddy Greeg Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon 2018
Caymus Vineyards Special Selection Cabernet Sauvignon 2019
Beau Vigne Owner's Reserve Guest Cottage Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Schrader Cabernet Sauvignon RBS Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard 2019

column7:
Belle Glos Clark & Telephone Pinot Noir is a dry red wine from the Santa Maria Wine Valley in California, known for its complexity of flavors and mild, velvety tannins. With every glass, you can expect deep oaky notes of chocolate and tobacco that are perfectly balanced with hints of cherry, blackberry and spices. 

This wine pairs perfectly with beef, veal, game, deer and poultry, so it’s great for pairing with rich, meaty dishes. Although according to some of our community, it also pairs well with lighter snacks such as almonds or olives, or in place of a dessert after dinner thanks to its fruity nose. 
This bottle from Belle Glos Winery is widely loved by the Vivino community, with its 2018 vintage coming in third out of all Californian Pinot Noir wines in the United States. 

At Vivino, we’re passionate about helping our community choose the right wine for them. Find out more about Belle Glos Clark & Telephone Pinot Noir, including pricing, vintages and reviews below.
column369: Belle Glos Clark & Telephone Vineyard Pinot Noir 2022

column7: Vibrant, complex aromas of ripe red and black fruit, lavender, and herbs fill the glass followed by pure, energetic flavors of dried cherry, blackberry, strawberry, licorice, and cocoa all pulled together with wet slate minerality, clean acidity, and ripe, seamless tannins.

Ever popular in the Vivino wine community, Chateau Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon embodies the rich heritage of California winemaking, showcasing a harmonious blend of bold flavor and refined elegance renowned in this area. With its luscious dark fruit and oaky notes, along with smooth, velvety tannins, the Chateau Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon offers a captivating embodiment of the prestigious Napa Valley terroir.

The Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon 2018 is particularly popular, and has earned itself almost 4,000 Vivino ratings, where the Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon 2019 has been given the accolade of featuring in the top 25 Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignons in the United States right now.

Offering an aesthetically pleasing dark, jewel-like red colour and appetising aroma, this full bodied wine opens up nicely with a smooth yet bold palate. The Chateau Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon pairs perfectly with beef, lamb, poultry and game such as deer and venison, making it a firm choice for dinner parties with hearty meat dishes. Its mouthfeel also complements mature and hard cheeses, making it a popular post-dinner accompaniment to a cheese board. Bon appétit!
column369: Buena Vista Chateau Buena Vista Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley 2020

column7: Dense, concentrated ruby color, hinting at the dark berry fruits and rich, textural components in this wine. On the nose, aromas of raspberry, wild blackberry and a slight earthiness. The palate is supple and layered with exotic spices, a rich meatiness, ripe plum, currant and black cherry flavors. The ripe tannins are nicely balanced with acidity, and the finish is long and fulfilling.
column369: Belle Glos Las Alturas Vineyard Pinot Noir 2021

column7: Deep purple in color. On the nose, the glass bursts with aromas of cocoa powder mingled with blackberries and vanilla. The palate bursts with juicy cherries and roasted figs.

column369: Erikson & Caradin Ivy & Thistle Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Armida Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir 2021
Sei Querce Six Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon 2016

column7: Notes of fresh cigar tobacco, inky mulberries, stewed blackberries, and violets. Aromas of ripe purple fruit fills the room upon opening. This three barrel selection was selected for its great intensity, remarkable weight, and vibrant fresh acidity.

column369: Verdon Estate Reserve No.3 Cabernet Sauvignon 2020
Thurlow Cellars Pit Viper Cabernet Sauvignon 2021
Verdon Estate Reserve No.5 Cabernet Sauvignon 2021

column7:
Smooth, rich and chocolatey are the top three things that spring to mind when the Vivino community thinks about Erikson & Caradin Bilateral Cabernet Sauvignon. Easily drinkable, this bold red wine is renowned for its rich, chocolate flavor profile, dark fruity notes and subtle hints of cherry. 

Want to know what to pair this wine with at your next dinner party? Our knowledgeable community suggests this wine goes exceptionally well with beef, lamb, game, poultry and mature cheese, making it perfect for enjoying alongside heavier dishes such as stews and casseroles. It’s also a great wine for sipping with a cheese board for a more savory take on a dessert. 

Erikson & Caradin Bilateral Cabernet Sauvignon 2020 vintage is popular among Vivino users with more than 70 ratings, while the 2018 vintage rates better than any other year of this particular wine.

If you want to find out more about this wine from our informative reviews, read more about its different vintages and browse the pricing, you’ve come to the right place. Vivino is the place to be for wine lovers all over the US.
Barrel Chaser is a supple, plush and ripe wine from the start. It is quick to begin with a beautiful fragrance of red flower potpourri, cherry preserves, light mocha, espresso bean and cola berry.

Inky dark purple, with fragrant, heady aromatics of warm blueberry cobbler, elderberry and black currants. Ripe plum and black raspberry notes are accented with cigar box, crushed herbs and fennel. Power with grace, this wine unfurls like a cherry blossom, revealing layers of blue and black fruit flavors. Cherry, olallieberry, and Zante currant, with truffle, lilac and sandalwood notes are integrated and well structured. Silky, fine grained tannins provide ample support for the voluptuous fruit. Positively sumptuous on the long, generous finish. Lingering cherry, red delicious apple and just a hint of mint display tenacious longevity. A wine with a lot to offer.

Deeply and intensely colored, this is a massive wine with a complex, sophisticated nose, offering black currant, cassis, sweet cherry and blackberry, with underlying layers of graphite, tobacco leaf, leather and wet gravel. Soft notes of menthol and desert sage weave together and integrate the aromas of fruit and earth. Breathtakingly bright fruit immediately greets the palate, juicy boysenberry, crushed cherries and fresh blueberries, with cranberry and raspberry accented by cedar, black plum and dried herbs. Powerful and rich, polished in style and structure, the opulent fruit core transitions seamlessly and exquisitely to a robust mid- palate showing black olive, licorice and eastern spices, finishing long and elegantly with black cherry, cocoa and plum. An outstanding vintage.

Whitehall Lane Cabernet Sauvignon Leonardini Estate 2018

column7: Aromas of raspberry and dark cherry with a hint of eucalyptus, The Oracle is decandent, but with finesse.

column369: J Dusi Paper Street The Narrator 2021

column7: The enticing aromas of ripe blackberry, boysenberry, fresh tobacco, brown spice and sweet mint are profound in the glass. Dense and well-structured, its supple tannins are complemented by notes of espresso, mocha and balanced with a silky and elegant finish.
